name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3479
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole moment, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +30°C. (2) The methyl group introduces a small rigid structure, contributing approximately +10°C. (3) The propanamide group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and raise the melting point by approximately +20°C. (4) The trifluoromethyl group also introduces a significant dipole moment, which can increase intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +30°C.
